data.name: Asphalt_7_-_Heat
data.value:
This was my second stint on the franchise. After the success of Asphalt 6, we wanted to polish it as much as possible and push the game to the limits of what the current devices could offer .The team started bigger then with Asphalt 6, so I was able to specialize in Artificial Intelligence and Gameplay. The Game Engine being very similar to the Asphalt 6 so I was also very useful maintaining and extending it.

Reviews :
IGN Score:8/10, Metacritic Score:83/100, WIRED Score:6/10, c|net Score:4/5, Excellent, Pocket Gamer Score:8/10, Silver Award

data.name: Fast_Five_the_Movie_-_Official_Game
data.value: I assisted remotely their Artificial Intelligence team to work on their AI system as the team on this project decided to use Asphalt 6's system as a base for their game.

data.name: Asphalt_6_-_Adrenaline
data.value:
Asphalt 6 was some sort of a reboot for the series, we started fresh and new with a small team, I was one of the two programmers who were part of this project from start to finish so I had big responsibilities in this project. For this game, I designed an implemented a racing AI system that I have maintained and still use today.

Reviews :
IGN Score:7.5/10, Metacritic Score:78/100, WIRED Score:8/10, Slide to Play Score:3/4, Good, Pocket Gamer Score:9/10, Gold Award

Reviews :

data.name: My_Hero-_Astronaut
data.value:
VG Creator was a sadly short lived studio that suffered like so many others from the hardships of 2008. Their best known work is Horse Life for the Nintendo DS. My Hero: Astronaut was to be released by Majesco in the US as a 3D space exploration game for Nintendo DS. The game had been anounced and and had been presented at the 2009 E3. It was however cancelled due to lack of funding.
I was main programmer on this project which required the building of a brand new game engine on top of the company's base library wrapper of the Nintedo DS functions.

data.name: My_Hero-_Astronaut_2
data.value:
Trailer
(From 0:40 to 1:00)

data.name: Crash_of_the_Titans
data.value:
This J2ME Midp 2.0 Beat Them Up game developed by the French company DeValley Entertainment is the first collaboration project with Vivendi Universal Games Mobile.

Just like Holy Wars, this project was just about done when I first started working for DeValley. I was asked to contribute to this project during the last weeks of crunch time and put in a few all-nighters to finish the game on time. I worked mostly on HUD display and some dialogue engine debugging.

Reviews :
Pocket Gamer.co.uk Score:5/10
Mobile Game FAQs Score:85/100
IGN(dead link) Score:6/10

data.name: Crash_of_the_Titans_2
data.value:
Trailer
Gameplay

data.name: Holy_Wars
data.value:
Holy Wars is J2ME Midp 2.0 Beat Them Up game developed by the French company DeValley Entertainment is was one of their most successful titles.

This project was already developed after I started working at DeValley, but I was put in charge of porting and resolving a lot of device specific bugs as we then covered about 650 different Java devices.

Reviews :
Pocket Gamer.co.uk Score:6/10

This was my first game ever, so I was learning the ropes. DeValley's code was extremely optimized and efficient and I coulnd't have found a better place to start off after finishing my studies.

data.name: Holy_Wars_2
data.value:
Trailer
Gameplay

data.name: Landers
data.value:
Landers is J2ME Midp 2.0 Shoot Them Up game developed by the French company DeValley Entertainment is one of my favorite mobile games, sadly I only worked on this project to add a score crypting component.

The game features an amazing soundtrack for a cell phone game, fast paced action and addictive gameplay.

Reviews :
Pocket Gamer.co.uk Preview
Project Next(dead link) Score : 90/100, Next Approved Award

data.name: Landers_2
data.value:
Trailer
Gameplay

data.name: Nowhere
data.value:
Nowhere is a J2ME Midp 2.0 Survival Horror Game developed by the French company DeValley Entertainment.

I was the lead programmer for the development of this project and also worked on some of the porting.

The really interesting feature about this project was its goal to create a very disturbing atmosphere, always trying to keep the player uneasy yet wanting to discover the rest of the game, just like the feelings that can be experienced when watching a classic horror movie.

I am especially proud of having worked on this game, but to present it a little more objectively, I will refer you to some of the reviews :

Hardcore Gaming review
Pocket Gamer.co.uk Score : 7/10, Bronze Award
Midlet-Review Score : 9/10, Mobile Game Award ( broken link :( )
Mobile Game FAQs(dead link) Score : 82/100, Silver Award
Project Next(dead link) Score : 89/100, Next Approved Award ( broken link :( )

Furthermore, the game was nominated for two awards at the Festival du Jeu Vidéo 2007, best scenario and best mobile game.

data.name: Nowhere_2
data.value:
Trailer
Gameplay

data.name: Spooks_the_Mobile_Game
data.value:
Spooks The Mobile Game is a J2ME Midp 2.0 Click and Play Game developed by Gameloft New York.

During this project I helped the Lead game designer with scripting while I also helped the two programmers debug the game before going gold.

This game follows the adventures of the famous british MI5 TV spies.
This was a very new experience for me as I served more of a very hybrid Game Designer role and wasn't programming much until the debugging phase. I has helped me in my future projects in retaining a very rich programmer - game designer dialogue.

Reviews :
Pocket Gamer.co.uk Score : 7/10, Bronze Award

data.name: Spooks_the_Mobile_Game_2
data.value:
Discontinued
Gameplay

data.name: The_Spiderwick_Chronicles
data.value:
The Spiderwick Chronicles is a J2ME Midp 2.0 Adventure Game developed by the French company DeValley Entertainment and published by Vivendi Universal Games Mobile.

I was the lead programmer for the development of this project.

This game was created in anticipation of the Paramount movie and was a licensed product designed to target the same audience that the movie and Tony DiTerlizzi and Holly Black's novels appeal to, such as younger audiences.

Vivendi Universal Games Mobile came to us with this project after we had finished Crash of the Titans, around August 2007 it seemed at the time like a good project to look into but one of the demands was very special: they would need the game to be developed in two months with one extra month of debugging, about half the time we usually spend on games. At that time the Paramount movie was expected to hit the theatres around January 2008.
The other developers were already deep into other projects so I was the only one relatively available putting the finishing touches on the game Nowhere, however I had just only finished my first game as a lead developer and that had taken me about 5 months with debugging. The added responsibility did not scare me and for some reason I really felt confident I could get the job done well and in time. Luckily for me I did!

This project succeeded because the two guys I worked with, brothers ( and game geniuses ) Simon and Etienne Perin really did a tremendous job as graphic artist and game designer respectively. The graphics are really top notch and are I believe by far the best feature of the game, and Etienne's work really made everything happen. His early game design documents were right on the money, and thanks to them I was able to schedule almost all the necessary coding tasks from the start of the project, we all put in a lot of extra hours early on and we were so conscious of the tight schedule that we actually ended the project a couple days early.

Reviews :

Pocket Gamer.co.uk Score : 7/10, Bronze Award

data.name: The_Spiderwick_Chronicles_2
